question.title: How to override Spring Batch Step ExitStatus when ItemReader.read() throws an exception?
question.body:
Problem

When my ItemReader.read() throws an exception, the step is marked FAILED. In my afterStep listener I try to override it with:

stepExecution.setStatus(BatchStatus.COMPLETED);
stepExecution.setExitStatus(ExitStatus.COMPLETED);

This makes the step show as COMPLETED in the repository, but in the job flow the JobExecutionDecider still receives the original FAILED ExitStatus.

How can I make the overridden ExitStatus propagate correctly so that flow transitions (on("*"), decider, etc.) see COMPLETED instead of FAILED?

I’m experimenting with Spring Batch and trying to override the exit status of a step when the ItemReader.read() method fails.

Here’s the test I have:

package com.mdp.mayaanonymizationengine;

import com.mdp.mayaanonymizationengine.core.AbstractDatabaseProperty;
import com.mdp.mayaanonymizationengine.core.IntegrationTest;
import lombok.extern.slf4j.Slf4j;
import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
import org.springframework.batch.core.*;
import org.springframework.batch.core.job.builder.JobBuilder;
import org.springframework.batch.core.job.flow.FlowExecutionStatus;
import org.springframework.batch.core.job.flow.JobExecutionDecider;
import org.springframework.batch.core.launch.JobLauncher;
import org.springframework.batch.core.repository.JobRepository;
import org.springframework.batch.core.step.builder.StepBuilder;
import org.springframework.batch.item.ExecutionContext;
import org.springframework.batch.item.ItemReader;
import org.springframework.batch.item.ItemStream;
import org.springframework.batch.item.ItemStreamException;
import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
import org.springframework.transaction.PlatformTransactionManager;

@Slf4j
@IntegrationTest
class BatchTest extends AbstractDatabaseProperty {

    @Autowired
    private JobLauncher jobLauncher;

    @Autowired
    private PlatformTransactionManager transactionManager;

    @Autowired
    private JobRepository jobRepository;

    @Test
    void testStepFailureOverriddenToCompleted() throws Exception {
        jobLauncher.run(
                testJob(jobRepository, transactionManager),
                new JobParameters()
        );
    }

    public Job testJob(JobRepository jobRepository,
                       PlatformTransactionManager transactionManager) {
        return new JobBuilder("testJob", jobRepository)
                .start(failingStep(jobRepository, transactionManager))
                .on("*").to(decider())
                .end()
                .build();
    }

    public Step failingStep(JobRepository jobRepository,
                            PlatformTransactionManager transactionManager) {
        return new StepBuilder("failingStep", jobRepository)
                .<String, String>chunk(1, transactionManager)
                .reader(new TestBatchReader())
                .writer(items -> {
                    // no-op
                })
                .listener(new StepExecutionListener() {
                    @Override
                    public void beforeStep(StepExecution stepExecution) { }

                    @Override
                    public ExitStatus afterStep(StepExecution stepExecution) {
                        System.out.println("afterStep called, overriding status to COMPLETED");

                        // Force batch + exit status
                        stepExecution.setStatus(BatchStatus.COMPLETED);
                        stepExecution.setExitStatus(ExitStatus.COMPLETED);

                        return ExitStatus.COMPLETED;
                    }
                })
                .build();
    }

    public JobExecutionDecider decider() {
        return (JobExecution jobExecution, StepExecution stepExecution) -> {
            System.out.println("Decider saw exit status: " + stepExecution.getExitStatus());
            return FlowExecutionStatus.COMPLETED;
        };
    }

    static class TestBatchReader implements ItemReader<String>, ItemStream {
        @Override
        public void open(ExecutionContext executionContext) throws ItemStreamException {
            log.info("Reader open called");
        }

        @Override
        public String read() {
            throw new RuntimeException("Simulated reader failure!");
        }
    }
}

What happens

  • The reader throws a RuntimeException.

  • The step listener’s afterStep callback sets both BatchStatus and ExitStatus to COMPLETED.

  • In the logs, the job finishes with BatchStatus=COMPLETED, as expected.

  • But the JobExecutionDecider still sees ExitStatus=FAILED;exitDescription=... from the exception.

My question

  • How can I reliably override the ExitStatus of a step when ItemReader.read() (or similar methods like process / write) throws an exception, so that both:

  • The persisted step status is updated, and

  • Flow transitions (JobExecutionDecider, on("...") mappings, etc.) also see the overridden exit status?

Is there a way to make the decider see my overridden ExitStatus, or do I need to handle this earlier than afterStep?

question_comments.body: Alternatively, define appropriate handling for the resulting failure, instead of post hoc trying to convert it into a completion.

This seems like an XY question. If your ItemReader can internally generate exceptions that should not be fatal to the step then surely the appropriate thing to do is catch them inside that component so that they don't propagate outward in the first place. And if an exception is thrown that you did not anticipate and allow (by catching it), then surely failing the step is the right response for the batch processor to exhibit.
